intro: Linosyris fominii, commonly known as the Fomin's linosyris, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture, typical of many species in the Polygonaceae family. Linosyris fominii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
